Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
Controller.GameEngine
public class GameEngine extends Object
The GameEngine class represents the startup phase of the game. It serves as the central component responsible for redirecting user requests to relevant functionality of the game. This class acts as the core of the game's execution and coordinates the various components to provide an interactive gaming experience.

The GameEngine class encapsulates the game's main loop and input handling. It initializes and manages the game's state, updates the game logic, and handles user input events.

Developers can extend this class to customize and add game-specific functionality. By overriding the appropriate methods, you can integrate your game logic seamlessly.

      public void start_game()
      Contains the main logic for the WarZone game and passes control to other aspects of the program when certain commands are entered.

    • assignCountries

      public boolean assignCountries(boolean p_test)
      This function is called after the command 'assigncountries' is given. It uses the players list and the countries present in the Map class to assign the countries equally to all the players. After assigning the countries this function sends the control over to the MainGameLoop class.
      Parameters:
      p_test - This boolean is for test only. Keep false otherwise.
      Returns:
      True if countries could be assigned

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(String p_InputPlayerName)
      This function is called after the command 'addPlayer' is given. If a player already exist it displays 'Player Already Exist', otherwise it adds the new player to the d_playersList and updates the d_playersList
      Parameters:
      p_InputPlayerName - The name of the player to add

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(String p_InputPlayerName)
      This function is called after the command 'removePlayer' is given. If a player already exist it removes the player from list and displays 'Player Removed Successfully', otherwise displays 'Player doesn't exist'.
      Parameters:
      p_InputPlayerName - The name of the player to remove

    • getAllMapsList

      public ArrayList<String> getAllMapsList()
      Retrieves a list of filenames from the specified directory containing maps.

      This method scans a directory for map files and returns a list of their filenames.

      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing the names of map files in the directory.
      See Also:
      • Commands.MAPS_DIRECTORY_PATH

    • getNumOfReinforcements

      public int getNumOfReinforcements(Player p_player)
      This method is used to calculate how many reinforcements are to be assigned to the given player based on the continents they hold.
      Parameters:
      p_player - The player for which we need to get number of reinforcements.
      Returns:
      NumberOfReinforcements
